entry.title: Erro “Destination not found” ao usar ABAP Cloud para consumir API via BTP
entry.content:
Olá pessoal,

Estou tentando consumir a API API_BUSINESS_PARTNER do SAP S/4HANA Cloud usando ABAP Cloud no SAP BTP. Meu código utiliza cl_http_destination_provider create_by_cloud_destination para criar o cliente HTTP, mas estou recebendo o erro:  Destino não encontrado.

Verifiquei a minha subconta de teste e existe um destino chamado S4HANA_API.

entry.title: SAP to Non-SAP Using ODATA Service
entry.content:
Hi All,
I am new to OData and have a requirement for SAP to Non-SAP integration. The goal is to create data in SAP, such as Vendor and Purchase Requisition, using OData services.

I have gone through different posts and blogs, but I am finding different solutions, which is a bit confusing. Could anyone please guide me on the actual process to achieve this? A clear explanation would also be helpful for beginners like me.

Your support and guidance will be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your time and assistance.

OData ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model API, @ABAP @ABAP_abap @odata

entry.title: My inbox PO enhancement with PO Changes as a composition
entry.content:
Hello, i'm trying to add a table of PO Changes made using CDS View into the Purchase Order Approval detail page in My Inbox.

I tried the mentioned blog below, but no success yet.

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/my-inbox-po-enhancement-with-approvers-as-a-composition/qaa-p/12673395#M4754835

I made the following CDS View to show the purchase changes and added it to C_PurchaseOrderFs Extension.

After that, i made a enhancement into MPC_EXT as mentioned in the blog trying to add the association into the Metadata of the SEGW service C_PURCHASEORDER_FS.

 

But, the change is not reflecting yet in the My Inbox App, i only see a new area with the title but no table is displayed there.
i have already tried to extend the SEGW service, but it does not work with My inbox. I also tried a new service, but that didn't work also. As i understood from the blog, the guys were able to solve it using the standard service and adding some enhancement only, but the main problem here is that i'm not able to see the associations and also, i'm unable to add the associations. 
Do you guys have any idea on how i could solve it?

thanks.

entry.title: What's the best way to call or use my custom Data Provider Class on my v4 OData service?
entry.content:
Since v4 Odata service uses standard class, what's the best approach on calling or using the custom model for data provider class?

Context: My Odata service is connected to custom fiori app. Also, i have created a custom class that contains custom logic. My behavior definition also calls the custom class that I've had created.

Objective: When an action button is used/pressed, I would like to call the class ZCL_QM_TEST which I would like to call the specific action which is get_entity.

Behavior definition code:

managed implementation in class ZCL_TEST unique;
strict ( 2 );

define behavior for Z_TEST_CDS
persistent table qals
lock master
authorization master ( instance )

{
   create;
   update;
   delete;
   field( mandatory ) InpsectionLot;

   action get_entity result [0..*] $self;
}

entry.title: Is there a way to get the list of all instructors through API ?
entry.content: Is there a way to get the list of all instructors through ODATA API ?

entry.title: How to update multiple entities in a single OData $batch request.
entry.content:
• I am sending one  $batch request with multipart/mixed format.

  • Inside, you created one changeset with 3 PATCH requests.

  • SAP will execute all 3 updates together.

  • If one fails (e.g. invalid IBAN), the whole changeset is rolled back.

 

 

--batch_001
Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary=changeset_001

--changeset_001
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

PATCH A_BusinessPartner('XXXX') HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
"BusinessPartnerCategory": "X",
"BusinessPartnerGrouping": "XXXX"
}
--changeset_001
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

PATCH A_BusinessPartnerAddress(BusinessPartner='XXXX',AddressID='XXX') HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
"CityName": "Dubai",
"PostalCode": "00000"
}
--changeset_001
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

PATCH A_BusinessPartnerBank(BusinessPartner='XXXX',BankIdentification='XXXX') HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
"BankName": "XXXXXXXXX",
"IBAN": "XXXXXXXXXXX"
}

--changeset_001--
--batch_001--

entry.title: Problem with oData Batch Update of SalesOrderItem
entry.content:
Hi 

I have looked at the following article related to the update of SalesOrderItem
ETag Handling | SAP Help Portal

It says

"The Etag handling feature is implemented on the A_SalesOrder node with the LastChangeDateTime property. If you want to use ETag handling for other entities (for example, A_SalesOrderItem), proceed as follows:

  1. Perform a GET operation to retrieve the content for the LastChangeDateTime property.

  2. Create a $batch request containing one changeset.

  3. As first operation of the changeset, include a PATCH A_SalesOrder with the LastChangeDateTime property. Provide the LastChangeDateTime content also in the request header in the If-Match field.

  4. As second operation of the changeset, include the desired payload (for example, POST A_SalesOrderItem or PATCH A_SalesOrderItem) with the relevant data"

With this in information I created the following XML with a view to update a single line initially.

<batchParts>
  <batchChangeSet>
    <batchChangeSetPart>
      <method>PATCH</method>
      <headers>
        <headerName>If-Match</headerName>
        <headerValue>W/"datetimeoffset'2025-09-10T07%3A27%3A59.4526150Z'"</headerValue>
      </headers>
      <A_SalesOrder>
        <A_SalesOrderType>
          <LastChangeDateTime>2025-09-10T07:27:59.452</LastChangeDateTime>
        </A_SalesOrderType>
      </A_SalesOrder>
    </batchChangeSetPart>
    <batchChangeSetPart>
      <method>PATCH</method>
      <A_SalesOrderItem>
        <A_SalesOrderItemType>
          <SalesOrder>1017493</SalesOrder>
          <SalesOrderItem>10</SalesOrderItem>
          <RequestedQuantity>26.2</RequestedQuantity>
          <RequestedQuantityUnit>TO</RequestedQuantityUnit>
        </A_SalesOrderItemType>
      </A_SalesOrderItem>
    </batchChangeSetPart>
  </batchChangeSet>
</batchParts>

After executing this using the following odata

I get the following error 

com.sap.gateway.core.ip.component.odata.exception.OsciException: Cannot invoke "String.equalsIgnoreCase(String)" because the return value of "java.util.Map$Entry.getKey()" is null, cause: java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "String.equalsIgnoreCase(String)" because the return value of "java.util.Map$Entry.getKey()" is null

 

Please can someone explain what the issue is with the

entry.title: LMS Expert! Please guide - Scheduled offerings Question
entry.content: I am working on retrieving all scheduled offerings from SF LMS. I found the following API, but it requires an instructorID as input: /learning/odatav4/public/admin/scheduledoffering-service/v1/ScheduledToTeachClasses?$filter=sttcCriteria/fromDate eq 1756473000000 and sttcCriteria/toDate eq 1856498200000 and sttcCriteria/instructorID eq 'instructorID' &expand=segments($select=*)&$select=* The challenge is that to get all scheduled offerings, I would need to call this API for every instructorID. However, I haven’t been able to find any API that provides a list of instructorIDs. Has anyone come across a way to retrieve instructorIDs, or is there an alternative approach to get all scheduled offerings without filtering by instructorID?

entry.content:
{
  "d": {

      "type": "SFOData.PerPerson"

    "createdDateTime": "/Date(1305980630000+0000)/",
    "createdOn": "/Date(1305980630000)/",
    "countryOfBirth": null,
    "placeOfBirth": null,
    "lastModifiedBy": "v4admin",
    "dateOfBirth": null,
    "customString2": null,

        "uri": "https://{CompanyURL}/odata/v2/PerPerson('UseriD')/customString1Nav"
      }
    },
    "personalInfoNav": {
      "results": []
    },

 

Hi,

I have a permission role set up in SAP SuccessFactors with following rules:

  • Employee central HRIS Odata permission is given to the user.
  • The granted user is given to a group containing a single user
  • The target population is selected as All employees
  • The effective dated entities [Personal Information] and employee data [Biographical information] is selected

Although I am getting a 200-response code when calling the endpoint https://{companyURL}/odata/v2/PerPerson({userID}),

The personalInfoNav is null.

entry.title: Integration Suite OData PATCH
entry.content:
Hi,

I am struggling for quite some time to sole issues regarding OData services. Now my problem is with Sales Order Item. I want to change Reject Reason in item, but with OData adapter.

This is my connection:

processing:

Content Modifier before:

 

This is from log:
odata:PATCH_ENTRY?serviceUri=${exchangeProperty.endpoint}/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_SALES_ORDER_SRV/
&resourcePath=RAW(A_SalesOrderItem(SalesOrder='0000000578',SalesOrderItem='000010'))
&alias=RAW(CUC_BO_SO_0109)
&authenticationType=Basic
&retrieveAllPages=true
&oDataMethod=PATCH_ENTRY
&contentType=application/atom+xml
&componentContentType=xml
&receiveTimeOut=60000&proxyType=default
&SystemQueryOption=RAW(sap-client=100&$format=json)
&retryOnFailure=false
&allowRequestHeaders=false
&setErrorResponseBody=true
&isKeyAutoGenerated=true
&allowResponseHeaders=false
&isCSRFEnabled=true
&serviceType=HCIOData&allowHttpSuccessPassThrough=true
&adapterVersion=1.26.0
&whitelistRequestHeaders=RAW(Accept:application/atom+xml|If-Match:*|content-type:application/atom+xml;type=entry)
&validateSystemQueryOption=true
&enableTLSSessionReuse=true
&enableMPLAttachments=false
&enableKeyManagerCache=true

 

And at the end error:

Error Details
com.sap.gateway.core.ip.component.odata.exception.OsciException: Request Payload Parsing Failed for one of the reason: (1) Either the OData metadata content available in the server is outdated OR (2) The request payload seems to be incorrect. Error Details : Entity Set entry not found in the edmx.

Thank you

entry.title: What end-to-end testing tools are best for SAP BTP (BAS) applications with CDS views and SAPUI5?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am working on SAP Business Application Studio (BAS) projects deployed on SAP BTP that use CDS views as the data model and SAPUI5 for the front end.

I would like to implement end-to-end testing for these applications. I am familiar with general-purpose tools like Playwright or WebdriverIO, but I am not sure if they are the best fit when testing applications in the SAP ecosystem (especially those with CDS/OData services and SAPUI5).

  • Has anyone successfully used Playwright or WebdriverIO for BAS/SAPUI5 projects?

  • Are there recommended frameworks or libraries specifically designed for UI5 applications?

  • What are the best practices for handling such tests?

  • Any tutorials, examples, or community resources you could share?

Thanks in advance for your insights!

entry.title: SAP CPI: Retrieve Iflow unique id(reg_id) via IFlow (workspace.svc/ContentEntities.ContentPackages)
entry.content:
Dear experts, 

There is an internal (unofficial) API for SAP CPI artifacts. 

 

https://<your-host>.hana.ondemand.com/odata/1.0/workspace.svc/ContentEntities.ContentPackages('<your-package>')/Artifacts?&$format=json

In comparison to the official API, it for packages it will give you an internal ID of an Iflow (reg_id). 
In browser, once one is logged into CPI, entering the URL will respond with JSON data back. 
But how to execute that in an automated Iflow?
I already tried to create OAuth2 (Code) credentials, read the Token via script and authenticate via Header. It did not work. 
Any hint, example is more than welcome.

thank you & kind regards | Simon

entry.title: SAP Build Apps – Deep Insert & Minimal Payload with S/4HANA OData (Create Inbound Deliveries)
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I’m working on a scenario where SAP Build Apps connects to an S/4HANA OData service (API_INBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV/A_InbDeliveryHeader). The goal is to create inbound deliveries from Build Apps with a minimal payload and include line items via a deep entity (to_DeliveryDocumentItem).

Challenge:

Create Record node

  • Forces mapping of all ~107 fields of the header entity, even if only 2–3 fields are needed.
  • Does not expose navigation properties (deep entities) for mapping.

HTTP Destination Request

  • Facing issues with endpoint resolution.
  • The relative path seems to end up in the request body instead of the URL.
  • Calls return 400 Bad Request.

Example payload I tried (items only):

 

{
  "to_DeliveryDocumentItem": {
    "results": [
      {
        "ActualDeliveryQuantity": "1000",
        "ReferenceSDDocument": "4500000763",
        "ReferenceSDDocumentItem": "10"
      },
      {
        "ActualDeliveryQuantity": "800",
        "ReferenceSDDocument": "4500000763",
        "ReferenceSDDocumentItem": "20"
      }
    ]
  }
}

 

Questions

  1. Is it a known limitation that Create Record does not support deep entities or minimal payloads?

  2. What is the recommended approach in Build Apps for:

    • Deep insert (header + items)

    • Partial updates (sending only required fields)

  3. For HTTP Destination Request, where should the relative path be set so it becomes config.url instead of being placed inside the body?

  4. Does the inbound delivery API support POST with deep entities, and what are the minimum required header fields?

  5. Any specifics to consider (e.g., $batch, sap-client, CSRF token handling)?

If anyone has a working example (endpoint + headers + minimal payload), it would be very helpful.

Thanks in advance for your guidance!

Best regards,
Aman K.

entry.title: F0797 App Extension OData Service - Manage Billing Docs.
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have successfully created a Fiori Extension Project in BAS for Fiori App F0797: Manage Billing Documents. I added a new custom action/button to the worklistview. The new button will update the billing date for the records selected in the worklist. In my app preview, the button is displayed correctly, and the popup is also working as expected and provided the user with the option to select the new billing date.

How to tie this to the backend SAP system for processing?
The OData project in SEGW is SD_CUSTOMER_INVOICES_MANAGE. My question is, do I need to create a copy of this project and add my custom logic in the DPC_EXT class?  Or, am I able to create a new service entirely and add it to my Extension project in BAS? The new service would only be enabled for my custom action/button. What is the preferred approach when extending Fiori Apps which are UI5 based?

Attached are my worklist custom controller. 

Br,
Jared
